snippet: Whether governments can be trusted to do what they say they will do is the question that will determine whether a Paris climate change accord has teeth.
abstract: New Analysis; World leaders enter final week of United Nations sponsored climate change negotiations in France; face impasse over monitoring transparency and annual funding of $100 billion to help poor countries convert to environmentally favorable energy solutions.

byline.contributor: Justin Gillis contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Whether governments can be trusted to do what they say they will do is the question that will determine whether a Paris climate change accord has teeth.

headline.print_headline: Pledges on Climate Will Be Useless Without Action and Funding
headline.main: Trust and Money at Core of Crucial Paris Talks on Climate Change

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
